k'ung futzu.gloss: Chinese philosopher whose ideas and sayings were collected after his death and became the basis of a philosophical doctrine known a Confucianism (circa 551-478 BC)

ku klux klan.gloss: a secret society of white Southerners in the United States

ku kluxer.gloss: a member of the Ku Klux Klan

kuangchou.gloss: a city on the Zhu Jiang delta in southern China

kubla khan.gloss: Mongolian emperor of China and grandson of Genghis Khan who completed his grandfather's conquest of China

kublai khan.gloss: Mongolian emperor of China and grandson of Genghis Khan who completed his grandfather's conquest of China

kudos.gloss: an expression of approval and commendation

kudu.gloss: either of two spiral-horned antelopes of the African bush

kudu lily.gloss: South African shrub having a swollen succulent stem and bearing showy pink and white flowers after the leaves fall

kudzu.gloss: fast-growing vine from eastern Asia having tuberous starchy roots and hairy trifoliate leaves and racemes of purple flowers followed by long hairy pods containing many seeds

kudzu vine.gloss: fast-growing vine from eastern Asia having tuberous starchy roots and hairy trifoliate leaves and racemes of purple flowers followed by long hairy pods containing many seeds

kuenlun.gloss: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kuenlun mountains.gloss: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kuhn.gloss: Austrian chemist who did research on carotenoids and vitamins (1900-1967)

kuiper.gloss: United States astronomer (born in the Netherlands) who studied the solar system and suggested in 1951 that there is a belt of comet-like debris at the edge of the solar system (1905-1973)

kuiper belt.gloss: a disk-shaped region of minor planets outside the orbit of Neptune

kuiper belt object.gloss: any of many minor planets in the Kuiper belt outside the orbit of Neptune at the edge of the solar system

kuki.gloss: Kamarupan languages spoken in western Burma and Bangladesh and easternmost India

kuki-chin.gloss: Kamarupan languages spoken in western Burma and Bangladesh and easternmost India

kulun.gloss: the capital and largest city of Mongolia

kumis.gloss: an alcoholic beverage made from fermented mare's milk

kumquat.gloss: any of several trees or shrubs of the genus Fortunella bearing small orange-colored edible fruits with thick sweet-flavored skin and sour pulp

kumquat tree.gloss: any of several trees or shrubs of the genus Fortunella bearing small orange-colored edible fruits with thick sweet-flavored skin and sour pulp

kunlan shan.gloss: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kunlun.gloss: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kunlun mountains.gloss: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kuomintang.gloss: the political party founded in 1911 by Sun Yat-sen

kurakkan.gloss: East Indian cereal grass whose seed yield a somewhat bitter flour, a staple in the Orient

kurchee.gloss: tropical Asian tree with hard white wood and bark formerly used as a remedy for dysentery and diarrhea

kurchi.gloss: tropical Asian tree with hard white wood and bark formerly used as a remedy for dysentery and diarrhea

kurdistan labor pary.gloss: a Marxist-Leninist terrorist group of Kurds trying to establish an independent Kurdish state in eastern Turkey

kurdistan workers party.gloss: a Marxist-Leninist terrorist group of Kurds trying to establish an independent Kurdish state in eastern Turkey

kuri-chiku.gloss: small bamboo having thin green culms turning shining black

kurosawa.gloss: Japanese filmmaker noted for blending Japanese folklore with western styles of acting (1910-1998)

kuroshio.gloss: a warm ocean current that flows northeastwardly off the coast of Japan into the northern Pacific ocean

kuroshio current.gloss: a warm ocean current that flows northeastwardly off the coast of Japan into the northern Pacific ocean

kurrajong.gloss: widely distributed tree of eastern Australia yielding a tough durable fiber and soft light attractively grained wood

kurrat.gloss: coarse Old World perennial having a large bulb and tall stalk of greenish purple-tinged flowers

kurt godel.gloss: United States mathematician (born in Austria) who is remembered principally for demonstrating the limitations of axiomatic systems (1906-1978)

kurt vonnegut.gloss: United States writer whose novels and short stories are a mixture of realism and satire and science fiction (born in 1922)

kurt waldheim.gloss: Austrian diplomat who was Secretary General of the United Nations from 1972 to 1981

kussmaul's coma.gloss: coma that can develop in inadequately treated cases of diabetes mellitus

kutch.gloss: tannin extract derived from any of several mangrove barks of Pacific areas

kutuzov.gloss: Russian field marshal who commanded the Russian opposition to Napoleon (1745-1813)

kuwait.gloss: a seaport on the Persian Gulf and capital of Kuwait

kuwait city.gloss: a seaport on the Persian Gulf and capital of Kuwait

kuwaiti dinar.gloss: the basic unit of money in Kuwait

kuwaiti dirham.gloss: worth one tenth of a Kuwaiti dinar

kuznets.gloss: United States economist (born in Russia) who developed a method for using a country's gross national product to estimate its economic growth (1901-1985)
